data.title: Texas Permanent School Fund Corporation
data.meta_description: Texas PSF’s executive team is comprised of professionals with deep, proven expertise in the areas of portfolio management, economics, risk management and statistical analysis; and a commitment to upholding the highest standards of prudence, transparency, and accountability. Robert Borden, CFA Robert Borden serves as Texas PSF Corporation’s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer, directing […]
data.text:
Robert Borden serves as Texas PSF Corporation’s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer, directing all investment and operations activities. He works with the corporation’s nine-member governing board to facilitate strategic planning, develop policy, and set the fund’s strategic asset allocation.

In 2011 he was a founding partner in the launch of Delegate Advisors and led that firm to profitability and success before selling his interest in 2022. He founded and served as Managing Partner for Palmetto Research Partners, LLC, an independent financial consulting firm, for more than 25 years.

Previously Borden worked as CEO/CIO of the South Carolina Investment Commission, managing $28 billion in assets at the time of his departure, and as both the executive director and CIO of the Louisiana State Employees’ Retirement System.

A native Texan, Borden started his career at Franklin Federal Bancorp in Austin where he served as Vice President. He went on to serve as Treasurer for Texas Mutual Insurance Company.

He holds a Master of Science in Finance from Louisiana State University, as well as Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance from the University of Texas at Austin. He is a Chartered Financial Analyst and Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst.

Stuart Bohart is Deputy Chief Investment Officer, responsible for strategic partnership development and oversight of the hedge fund, direct lending, and co-investment portfolios. Prior to joining Texas PSF in 2024, Mr. Bohart served in executive management and advisory roles in the asset management industry, including as President of quantitative firm FORT Investment Management and as Senior Managing Director of diversified alternatives firm Fortress.

From 1997 until 2010, Mr. Bohart worked in various roles at Morgan Stanley including co-head of Global Investment Management, global head of Prime Brokerage, Portfolio Manager for a multi-strategy hedge fund, and as a member of the Morgan Stanley Management Committee. He has lived and worked in the People’s Republic of China, Japan, and the United Kingdom.

Mr. Bohart graduated from Northwestern University with a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics and Asian studies and has a certificate in Strategic Planning from the Harvard Business School.

Fernando Garza serves as Senior Vice President and Chief Audit Officer. Before joining Texas PSF, Mr. Garza was Vice President of Corporate Audit at Delta Community Credit Union where he led the development and execution of the annual risk assessment and audit plan, ensuring alignment with the strategic goals and objectives of the organization.

Mr. Garza has over 15 years of experience in internal audit, risk management, and financial services, working with large and international institutions in executive roles. He has a proven track record of driving organizational change and growth through effective team leadership, data analytics, and communication with executives, boards, and regulators.

He holds a Master of Business Administration from Rice University and a Bachelor’s of Business Administration degree from The University of Texas at San Antonio. He also holds a CPA, CISA, and CIA credentials. Mr. Garza is a veteran who served in the United States Army as a Paratrooper with the 82nd Airborne Division.

Mike Meyer serves as Senior Vice President and Acting Chief Financial Officer, providing strategic leadership across Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, and Planning and Budget, among other areas.

Prior to joining Texas PSF, Meyer served as Deputy Commissioner of Finance at the Texas Education Agency (TEA). In this role, he was responsible for overseeing agency finance, school finance, grant compliance and administration, internal audit, and the Texas Permanent School Fund until it became a standalone entity in January 2023.

His prior experience includes numerous senior leadership roles, including Interim Deputy Commissioner of Operations at TEA, Chief Financial Officer of the Texas Juvenile Justice Department and Deputy Director of Budget, Planning and Policy in the Office of the Governor.

Meyer holds a Master’s degree in Public Affairs and a Master of Arts degree in Latin American Studies from the University of Texas at Austin, along with a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics from Luther College in Decorah, Iowa.
